climbs.name: Mont de Vénus
climbs.fa: Dominic Asselin, Mathieu Oulet and Johanne Paquette, été 2004

content.description:
Very nice route, made up of three pitches which are different in style. (3 pitches; 235')

P1 5.9 70ft

Start in the crack, to reach the slab and finish at the top of it. (better to protect the crack or use a stick-clip)

P2 5.10 35ft

Star to the left to follow the big crack for a few meters, then go straight up the delicate passage, then you have to leave the face, the anchor is a little above slightly to the left.

P3 5.11a 50ft

Go straight to go around the roof to the right, cross to the left to reach the crux, after few difficult moves the anchor is located just above.

The descent can be done in two abseils by stopping at the top of the 2nd pitch (1 with two 70 meters ropes) 



The route start from the ledge located at the top of the rock stairway.

10 quickdraws and equipment to make a relay are sufficient.
Located in the Ouareau Forest regional park, this cliff is not often visited, Very sunny, it is a beautiful site to visit in fall
